text: Bishop John Christopher Mahon, D.C.L, S.P.S. (1922-2004), was an Irish born priest a member of the Kiltegan Fathers. He served as Bishop of Lodwar, Turkana, Kenya from 1978 until 2000.Bishop John Christopher Mahon Catholic Hierarchy Mahon was born on 25 December 1922 in Killurin, Killeigh, Co. Offaly, Ireland.Bishop Mahon Killeigh Parish Website He was educated at Tullamore C.B.S., and Knockbeg College, Carlow. He was ordained a priest in 1948. Mahon studied Canon Law in St. Patrick's College, Maynooth earning a doctorate in 1951. He joined the teaching staff of the Saint Patrick's Society for the Foreign Missions, Kiltegan.Bishop John Mahon, 1922 - 2004 St. Patrick's Missionary Society Dr Mahon left Kiltegan in 1959 when he was appointed to the Roman Catholic Diocese of Ogoja, Nigeria, where he was Head of St. Thomas’ Teacher Training College. After nine years in Nigeria, Rev. Mahon moved to Kenya, after the outbreak of the Nigerian Civil War. Mahon was ordained first Bishop of Lodwar on April 25, 1978. He died in Nairobi, Kenya suddenly on November 10, 2004, aged 82, and is buried where he served as bishop in Turkana, Kenya.Kenya: Retired Bishop Dies All Africa Stories ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2004 deaths Category:Irish Roman Catholic priests Category:Roman Catholic missionaries in Kenya Category:20th- century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Kenyan Roman Catholic bishops Category:Irish expatriate Catholic bishops Category:Alumni of St Patrick's College, Maynooth Category:People from County Offaly
